quiz.text: Urbanization is best defined as:
options: People moving from rural areas to urban areas
The growth in the population of urban areas as a result of several factors
The increase in the proportion of people living in urban areas
People moving from urban areas to rural areas
None of the above

quiz.text: Urbanization is the result of
options: Educational development
Rural development
Migration of population from villages to cities
Agricultural development
Both A and B

quiz.text: Which Article of the Indian Constitution allows citizens to migrate freely within India?
options: Article 14
Article 15
Article 19
Article 21
Article 18

quiz.text:
Consider the following in relation to the causes of urbanization and select the correct answer from the code given below:
  1. High rate of emigration from rural to urban areas.
  2. Increasing number of educational institutions in cities.
  3. High rate of industrialization.
  4. High standard of living in rural areas.
options: 1, 2, and 3 Only
2, 3, and 4 Only
1, 2, and 4 Only
1, 3, and 4 Only
All of the above

quiz.text:
On what basis census of India enumerates migration? 
  1. Place of birth
  2. Place of residence
  3. Place of death
Which of the following statement/s is/are correct?
options: 1 only
2 only
1 and 2 only
2 and 3 only
All of the above

quiz.text: What is a continuous urban spread constituting a town and its adjoining outgrowths (OGs), or two or more physically contiguous towns together with or without outgrowths of such towns?
options: Out growths
Urban Agglomeration
Census town
Statutory town
None of these

quiz.text:
Which of the following is/are the consequences of migration?
  1. Increase in Remittances
  2. Development of slums in urban areas.
  3. Alteration of age and sex composition of states.
  4. Social changes.
  5. Physical and mental stress on women.
Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
options: 2, 3 , 4 and 5 only
1, 2, 3 and 4 only
2, 4, and 5 Only
3, 4 and 5 only
All of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following is not an approach in Human Geography ?
options: Areal Differentiation
Quantitative Revolution
Spatial Organization
Exploration and Description
Any of the above

quiz.text: What is the trend of Urbanization in India?
options: Urban Population is rising rapidly
Urban Population is Falling
Growth rate of urban population is lower than total
Urban Population is rising slowly
None of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the Malthusian Theory of Population:
  1. This theory states that the food supply increases in arithmetical progression whereas the population increases in geometrical progression.
  2. The theory underestimates scientific and technological advancements.
Which of the following statements is/are correct?
options: 1 only
2 only
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
Any of the above

quiz.text: Change of population in particular area between two points of time is known as â€“
options: Growth of Population
Growth Rate of Population
Positive Growth of Population
Negative Growth of Population
Natural Growth of Population

quiz.text:
Which of the following bodies was associated with conducting the Socio-Economic Caste Census 2011:
  1. Ministry of Home Affairs
  2. Ministry of Rural Development
  3. Ministry of Urban Development
  4. Ministry of Housing and Urban Poverty Alleviation
  5. The Office of the Registrar General & Census Commissioner
Select the correct answer from the codes given below:
options: 2 and 3 only
2, 3 , 4 and 5 only
1, 2, 3 and 4 only
All of the above
1, 3, 4, and 5 only

quiz.text:
What are the differences between rural and urban settlements?
  1. Rural Settlements depend on primary activities whereas urban settlements depend on secondary and tertiary activities.
  2. Social relations among rural people are informal whereas formal among urban
Which of the following statements is/are correct?
options: 1 only
2 only
Both 1 and 2
Neither 1 nor 2
Any of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following is a negative consequence of migration?
  1. It put pressure on social and physical infrastructure in the urban areas
  2. It creates anonymity, which creates a social vacuum and a sense of dejection among individuals
  3. Remittances from international migrants are one of the major sources of foreign exchange
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
Only 1 and 2
Only 1 and 3

quiz.text: Urbanism is mainly the study of
options: Process of urban growth
Growth of the urban population
The character of city life
Both A and B
None of these

quiz.text: Which of the following statements is incorrect regarding the settlement hierarchy?
options: Isolated dwellings consist of individual units
When many individual units are clustered together they form hamlets
A megalopolis is a large city, with a population of at least one million living in its urban agglomeration
Cities with population of 5 million and above are known as mega cities
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which of the following 'pull factors' impact, migration:
  1. Good opportunities for work
  2. Better health facilities
  3. Poverty
  4. Higher wages
Choose the correct option.
options: Only 1, 2 and 4
Only 1, 2 and 3
Only 2, 3 and 4
Only 1 and 3
All of the above

quiz.text: Meaning of Suburb is
options: The process of growth of urban population
The study of the life of the city
The movement of people out of cities to the surrounding areas
A residential district located on the outskirts of a city
None of the above

quiz.text:
Consider the following statements regarding the Principle of Non-refoulement.
  1. The principle of Non-refoulement forbids a country receiving asylum seekers from returning them to a country in which they would be in likely danger of persecution.
  2. The principle also applies to states that are not parties to the 1951 Convention Relating to the Status of Refugees or its 1967 Protocol.
Which of the following option is correct?
options: Statement 1 is correct Only.
Statement 2 is correct Only.
Both Statements are correct.
Neither Statements are correct.
Statement 2 is the correct explanation of statement 1.

quiz.text: Satellite town refers to
options: The expansion of poorly planned, low-density, auto-dependent development, which spreads out over large amounts of land
A smaller metropolitan areas which are located somewhat near to, but are mostly independent of, larger metropolitan areas
The movement of people out of cities to the surrounding areas
A territorial coalescence of two or more cities whose peripheral zones have grown together
None of the above

quiz.text:
Which one of the following statements regarding Census towns is correct. ?
  1. A minimum population of 5,000.
  2. At least 50% of the male main working force engaged in non-agricultural activities.
  3. Population density of at least 400 persons per sq km.
options: Only 1
Only 2
Only 3
Only 1 and 2
Only 1 and 3

quiz.text:
Basic characteristics of urbanization in India can be highlighted as:
  1.  Massive growth of slums
  2. Industrialization and a strong economic base
  3. Poor quality of urbanization
  4. Urbanisation occurs due to urban pull
options: Only 1 and 3
Only 1 and 2
Only 1 and 4
Only 2 and 3
Only 1, 2 and 4

quiz.text: Study the given graph carefully and answer the following questions: Answer the following questions Q. How does the natural increase in population occur, as per the graph?
options: Birth Rate â€“ Death Rate + Migration
Death Rate + Birth Rate + Migration
Growth Rate- Birth Rate - Migration
Birth Rate + Migration - Birth Rate
Technology + Migration - Death Rate

quiz.text: Study the given graph carefully and answer the following questions: Q.  Which of the following countries is expected to have a relatively higher proportion of the old age population?
options: The country with the highest birth rate and the highest death rate
The country with the highest birth rate and the lowest death rate
The country with the lowest birth rate and the highest death rate
The country with the lowest birth rate and the lowest death rate
None of the above

quiz.text: Study the given graph carefully and answer the following questions: Q. From the given graph, what condition can you infer about the underdeveloped countries?
options: High Birth Rate and Low Birth Rate
Low Birth rate and Low Death rate
High Birth Rate and High Death Rate
Low Birth Rate and High Death Rate
None of the above

quiz.text: Study the given graph carefully and answer the following questions: Q. In which stage of Demographic Transition, population explosion took place :
options: Stage I
Stage II
Stage III
Post Stage III
None of the above

quiz.text: An area will be described as urban if it has
options: High population
Has towns and cities
Has a high proportion of people in non-agriculture pursuits
There is the formality of relations among inhabitants
All of the above

quiz.text: Which one of the following types of migration has contributed most in population movement in India in 2011?
options: Rural to rural
Urban to rural
Rural to urban
Urban to urban
Both A and B

quiz.text: Which one of the following is a result of rapid industrialization and urbanization?
options: Urban decay
Rural depopulation
Rural regeneration
Urban depopulation
None of the above

quiz.text: Which of the following  about migration around the world is NOT correct?
options: International Organisation for Migration (IOM) is an NGO that helps UN to form policies on migration
SDG 10.7 focuses on migration
IOM was established in 1951
The number of Migration in 2019 reached 272 million.
Female migrants constituted 48 percent of this international migrant stock.
